page.title: 18Knowle Library
page.content: The library is in Chester House which was built in the 15th Century and restored in 1975. It is situated in the High Street and they have 10,000 books. They spend Â£10,000 on books a year. The library often has displays upstairs and art galleries. 5000 adults and 2000 children are members of the library. The charge for the late books is 4p a day for adults.2p for pensioners and 1p for children. 6 people work in the library. They register a book on a computer system called Plessey. The classification system is called the Duey Decimal system which is a lot of numbers from 1 - 10000. There is a readers club for children and when the answer questions from the book they have to read they get so many points and get a badge for every 100 points.
